metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6891 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Two errors in the "asn1_find_node()" function (lib/parser_aux.c) within GnuTLS libtasn1 version 4.10 can be exploited to cause a stacked-based buffer overflow by tricking a user into processing a specially crafted assignments file via the e.g. asn1Coding utility.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtasn1-3-bin - 3.4-3ubuntu0.5
libtasn1-6 - 3.4-3ubuntu0.5
libtasn1-bin - 3.4-3ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtasn1-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-3ubuntu0.5').
